intro: Iberis amara proles serotina, commonly known as the late-flowering bitter candytuft, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are hairy and have a distinctive bitter taste, which is reflected in its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas.
